Name: Karak: Regent
Description:
Long before the dragon‘s arrival, Karak was ruled by a powerful and cruel lord. Brave heroes could stop but not destroy him. Now he is coming back to restore his reign. Will you stop him or help him?

Karak: Regent is an expansion pack for Karak – you must have the basic game to play it. It brings 4 new heroes and many other components. Most of all, however, it introduces a new game mode – the Lord of Karak, in which one of the players takes on the role of the fallen ruler and tries to restore his ancient power.

—description from the publisher

Name: Арктика (Arctic)
Description:
Eat or be eaten on the North pole.
In this asymmetric game, you are either an Eskimo hunter, an orca, a polar bear or a seal. Each hunter has his own move options: swimming in sea, moving on ice floes or a combination of both. The ice floes drift each turn, changing the game board and your tactical options.
The player with the most food points wins the game.

—description from the designer

Name: Wolves of Mercia: The Emissary Promo Card
Description:
The Emissary is a limited edition promo card. It adds an additional villager role to the base game of Wolves of Mercia.

Was included as part of the KS campaign.

Name: Neon party
Description:
A new neighborhood has been built and the people who live there don't know each other. A neon party is organized to get to know each other. You also live in this neighborhood. If you decorate your house with as many lights as possible, you will make a good impression. Do you know after the neon party who lives on who on which house number lives? Then you have a big chance of winning the neon party game!

The player tries to get many points as possible on his house number. The players don't know each other's house number. There are 2 sets of house numbers cards 1-5. One of them are placed in the middle of the table. Each player receives a secret housenumber from the other set of 1-5.

The rest of the cards consist cards with numbers -5 (defect neon lights) to 5(working neon lights) and a few special cards. These cards form the draw pile. If it is a players turn, he will take a card from the draw pile. He can place this card on both sides of a house number. Then it's the next players turn and he does the same. If there is a total of 5 cards on both sides of a house number, there is a scoring. 
First, it is determined which side of this house number has the most cards. The side with the most cards will be placed on table below the house number card. For the order house numbers, the same side will be placed below the house number card. The entire other side of the house numbers with cards will be placed on the discard pile. After this, there are no more neon light cards on table (except below the house numbers and the discard pile). Then the game continues. If there are 5 cards placed at a house number another scoring takes place. The game ends when the draw pile is used up.

There are 2 special cards with which you can remove cards and do 2 turns in a row.

The players then guess from each other which house number they have. Each correctly guessed house number earns 5 points. If someone is well guessed by all persons, he is out of the game and therefore does not participate in the final scoring.

Everyone counts the points on the cards under their house number. The player with the most points wins the game.

—description from the publisher

Name: Frozen Unicorns
Description:
Frozen Unicorns is the game for all ages that challenges players to transform their bodies into frozen pirates, frozen monkeys and frozen unicorns and dozens of other hilarious people and animals.

As one player closes their eyes all other players look at one card and freeze into a statue, attempting to convey the identity on the card.  The guesser then opens their eyes to a room of statues and has to guess what people are.

You can compete to see who is the best statue maker and smartest guesser, or work together to make ridiculously funny co-operative human statues.

—description from the publisher

Name: PARKS: Season of Tantrum Promo Card
Description:
A promotional Season card that was obtainable through the "Tantrum House Board Game Media: Season 6" Kickstarter campaign.

Adds a new available season into the core game's existing deck of 10 Seasons.

Name: Master Of Sumo
Description:
Master of Sumo is a board game inspired in the traditional sumo combat... but know, in a post-apocalyptic future.
Welcome to this crazy and fast game, choose your sumo, and fight for the victory and the glory.

In your turn, you can move your sumo character over the tatami and fight your opponent using your abilities cards and special movements. If the life counter of your opponent reach 0, you win

—description from the designer

Name: Kingdom Death: Monster – Strain Milestone and Story of Blood
Description:
Promo content included with the 10th Anniversary White Speaker, a miniature that is not part of the game. Along with a Strain milestone that continues the story after the White Speaker stories are revealed, the survivors have a chance to learn a new type of evolving fighting art.

1 x Strain Milestone card
4 x Story of Blood fighting art cards
Story of Blood / Strain System double-sided rules sheet

Name: Blackpool
Description:
Blackpool is a strategy and racing board game designed for both, entertainment and intellectual stimulation. A fun game for parties, family gatherings, or just a casual evening with friends, Blackpool is designed to engage kids and grown ups alike.

Along with luck, you will need to use sound strategies to win this game. To win, you have to be the first player to get all of your travellers (the tokens are called travellers in Blackpool) out of the mystic whirlpool and land them safely back to your camp. You can use curse cards to stop others, charm cards to move ahead, and take advantage of anyone who is ahead of you by using the special piggybacking technique. You can jump on someone who is ahead of you to slow them down, or move ahead with them. Smart use of piggybacking can become the difference between winning and losing the game.

The race starts from the middle of the board, and the players have to move outwards. Each player has three ‘travellers’ whom they have to save from the whirlpool. In order to do so, the travellers have to get to their camps, which are at the corners of the board. The travellers have to go through several rings to get to the camp. Like a real whirlpool, in Blackpool, it gets easier to move as you get further away from the center. The players movement depends on the dice roll and on the ring they are at. The first player to get all their travellers to their camp wins the game.

—description from the designer

Name: Kingdom Death: Monster – 10th Anniversary Survivors
Description:
The 10th Anniversary Survivor figures are accompanied by Patterns for Kingdom Death: Monster. A Pattern represents a spark of crafting inspiration that accompanies insight gleaned about the world. When survivors reach their insights, draw a Pattern. It will describe what to use and how to craft a brand new piece of gear. When these crafting elements are assembled a new idea takes physical form.

The 10th Anniversary Survivors are packed in a box featuring a random commemorative cover and includes:

4 x Hard plastic 10th Anniversary Survivors (Allister, Zachary, Lucy, Erza)
4 x Hard plastic Kingdom Death 30mm unique scenic base inserts
4 x Hard plastic Kingdom Death 30mm round base
4 x Large matte print of the concept artwork for each survivor on heavy card stock
6 x Pattern cards
8 x Pattern gear cards
Pattern rules sheet

One extinguishing lantern after another, the grizzled foursome persevered. The insight gleaned from their life in the darkness has ignited a spark of ingenuity.

In celebration of 10 years since the release of the first Kingdom Death figure, we revisit the starting survivors of Monster, Allister, Zachary, Lucy, and Erza. A lantern decade into their survival, these reimagined figures show the ingenuity and grit required to endure the darkness.

—description from the publisher

Name: PitchFest
Description:
PitchFest is a card-driven improv party game about pitching ridiculous video games. It's going to be a wonderful idea... until the publishers get their money-filled hands on it.

The pitch is constructed using four prompt cards from the deck, after which the 'developer' (a single player or team) presents their game concept to the rest of the group.

The rest of the players are 'investors' that then ask yes/no questions about the pitch and product to ascertain whether or not they want to fund the game. The developer then must draw an answer card to determine how they are allowed to answer the question, requiring quick thinking and improv storytelling techniques.

The goal of the game is to collaboratively create the best pitch of the night.

—description from the designer

Name: Supertall: Spires
Description:
Add height and value to your towers with spires of all types.

This expansion adds 6 Spire cards to add height and value to your skyscraper design.

At the start of the game, randomly choose 1 more than the number of players.

Spires can be claimed by any skyscraper that meets the requirement. They are treated like other floor cards and can be moved around after claimed.

At the end of the game, each spire scores 3 bonus points if its requirement is still met.


Released in the May 2019 Board Game of the Month Club $10+ package.

Name: Manchukuo: Leaders of Xinjing
Description:
Every good master knows it's best to lead from the front! With the Leaders of XÄ«njÄ«ng expansion, you can join your students out in the field, giving a more direct hand in the action.

Leaders of Xinjing introduces asymmetrical player powers, which come in the form of your leader cards. Choose one of the eight leaders as your master, and assign your school's special leader meeple to tasks alongside your students. While your leader does not contribute its own labor value to the task, it does lend a special ability or quality to your action, and their influence can give you a significant advantage when it comes to recruiting new students!

—description from the publisher

Name: Manchukuo: Rise of the Resistance
Description:
Southern China faces its own troubles. The League of Nations is paralyzed by inaction. It seems that the people of Manchukuo must stand for themselves if they are to survive the occupation.

By adding the Rise of the Resistance content, you and your fellow masters can contribute directly to the efforts of the resistance fighters. Sending supplies and able hands can reward you with great prominence at the risk of garnering further suspicion. The more you and your peers contribute, the better the Resistance will fare, which can turn the tide of the entire conflict!

—description from the publisher

Name: Questicus
Description:
Welcome to the world of Questicus, a hand-drawn adventure of epic questing and fierce competition for up to 3 to 6 players. The idea is simple: become the most influential adventurer in a given time to become the next Mayor of the Town and win the game. Your worst enemy is your fellow players as they are also fighting for power and influence. Utilize an arsenal of magical items, cunning skills, and secretive plots to become the reigning Mayor over the land!

Enjoy an engaging adventure as players create the map as they explore the world around them. With 38 unique tiles and over 50 special events, you’ll never play the same game twice! Every time you start a game you will be thrown into a brand new experience with new challenges and different strategies for you to apply. Vie for power and influence with one of twelve exciting characters! Will you choose to be a good adventurer seeking to help the people, or an evildoer who seeks to destroy all those that stand in their way? In Questicus the choice is yours with each character having their very own stats and abilities specific to them.

Worried a game might drag on too long? Afraid that the game will be over to soon? Well fear not, Questicus has just the thing for you! With Questicus, we set up a way to keep track of how many rounds are left in a game by using “Town Event” cards. Each round, one of these cards will be drawn and revealed with a special event that all players participate in. Customize your experience with a simple game of 10 rounds, or go in for the long haul and set up a 35 round game! The choice is up to you, as we know players like games tailored to their needs and with Questicus you are given the freedom to choose the length of the game you want to play.

Are you ready to get questing?

—description from the designer

Name: Blood Bowl (2016 edition): Lizardmen Pitch & Dugout Set
Description:
The jungles of the New World are riddled with the remains of ancient temples, built by the Lizardmen in service to their Slann masters. This reversible Blood Bowl pitch features one such ruin, in two different states. On one, the temple lies dormant, the flora and fauna of the rainforest threatening to reclaim it. On the other side, the temple has been pressed into new service by the Lizardmen, with fresh glyphs and blazing pyres.

You’ll also find a pair of matching double-sided dugouts to complete the theme. Each dugout features a score tracker, boxes for Reserves, Knocked Out and Serious Injury, plus goal and re-roll trackers. Rules to use each side of the pitch are included for easy reference.

—description from publisher

Name: Forsaken Forest: Spirit Uprising
Description:
Spirit Uprising is the Ethereal Expansion to Forsaken Forest.

The spirits have broken free from their eternal prison... and they want vengeance! In Spirit Uprising, the role of Spirits changes dramatically, as many cards allow dead players to possess living players, be Reincarnated, and even return to the plane of the living for some ghostly revenge.

Spirit Uprising adds levels upon levels of strategy, mind-games, card synergies, and new mechanics to the game.

Including in the expansion are 10 game-changing new Roles, eight perilous Destinations, eight terrifying Forest Cards, and over twenty powerful Travelers Cards, including a new card type - Contraptions. These cards shape the game in new and exciting ways together.

There are countless new possible card interactions, and predicaments that players can get themselves into.

Name: Combatendo o Cyberbullying
Description: Edu and his robotic friend Ludo built a social network called Cyberface so that their friends the fuze Teka, the cat Zum, the strong Montanha and the smart Zeca could safely share their photos so that friends have fun posting their photos and that no funny guy resolve to disrupt the fun by making a healthy and safe environment.

Name: Move Mundo Kids
Description:
All around the world, population growth and disordered city growth pose major problems. Mobility, accessibility and environmental issues are among the main.

Move Mundo Kids is a serious game where players take on the role of transformative agents and build a smart city that provides solutions to these problems.

With building mechanics and area management through tiles, the kids build a new city with every match. When building problems can arise and from them discussions on how to solve them.

Name: Pontus Euxinus
Description:
Before 1204, the Black Sea remained closed to foreign merchants. The Fourth Crusade facilitated its opening to Venetians who barely reaped any profits. Only after 1261, in competition with the Genoese, did the Venetians organize the first commercial activities related to high-value cargo. Despite the difficulties in recruiting and commanding the crews, the connections with the Black Sea were essential for the Venetian economy in the period.

At Pontus Euxinus, players take on the role of traders sailing the difficult Black Sea, with all its challenges, to earn profits for their family and reputation for their home. Throughout the game, players will need to not only make the most of the goods they transport, but also build ports along the huge coastline, build cities and establish influence at various points.

The game works through an innovative system of data use in which each round the parameters change and the players need a good planning to face the difficulties. Navigate, trade and exert your influence and be the great Black Sea trader in this strategy game that mixes tactics and luck.

—description from the designer

Name: Bunaken
Description: Bunaken National Marine Park is a hidden paradise under the sea. Located in Manado, North Sulawesi, Bunaken is famous for its underwater park charm which is overgrown with various types of colorful and gorgeous coral reefs. To add those gems, are various types of fish and marine life hiding behind the coral reefs. The colorful reefs combined with the types of marine life are true eyes opener. All These charm are what makes the diving and snorkeling enthusiasts always choose Bunaken as the first destination when they want to enjoy this one of the world’s iconic underwater beauties. Come and snap pictures of the existing biota. Set a strategy to determine the biota you want to photograph. Use your diving skills with the diving cards in your hands, such as 2-5 diving cards, then you can dive from 2 to 5 depth or from 5 to 2. Don’t let other players snap your biota’s pictures first. Remember, you can get points from the biota collection as well as from your diving expertise. So collect as many biota photos and be a reliable diver to win the game.

Name: RONE: Complete Edition
Description:
RONE — Races of New Era — is a strategic post-apocalyptic card game for 2 to 4 players. Players are immersed in a dark world full of destruction and suffering, a world where people are fighting to take back their place after a global nuclear war annihilated all achievements of the human race and all that was left was only a handful of usable resources.

This Complete Edition of RONE includes the Core set with all released expansions in one big box. For back compatibility with the first or second edition, the cards are populated with an expansion symbol to easily distinguish which card belongs to which expansion.

-description from publisher

Name: Carcassonne Maps: France
Description:
With Carcassonne Maps we offer you a new possibility to play Carcassonne. With Carcassonne Maps: France you can use your tiles and meeples in France, build French cities and influence the course of important roads. There are also new ways to score points, e.g. by winning the scoring of a big city or by connecting streets to neighbouring countries.

The map consists of high-quality, strong, linen-embossed paper and has the size A1.

—description from the publisher

Name: Battle of the Chefs
Description:
Battle of the chefs is the delicious board game where everything revolves around food! Be the first to try to answer all questions correctly and to earn all chef hats. Once you have all 6 of them try to get to the finish as quickly as possible so that you can call yourself the winner of the Battle of the Chefs!

—description from the publisher (translated)

Name: Carcassonne Maps: Benelux
Description:
With Carcassonne Maps we offer you a new possibility to play Carcassonne. With Carcassonne Maps: Benelux you can use your tiles and meeples in Benelux Union, build cities and influence the course of important roads. There are also new ways to score points, e.g. by winning the scoring of a big city or by connecting streets to neighbouring countries.

The map consists of high-quality, strong, linen-embossed paper and has the size A1.

—description from the publisher

Name: Carcassonne Maps: Great Britain
Description:
With Carcassonne Maps we offer you a new possibility to play Carcassonne. With Carcassonne Maps: Great Britain you can use your tiles and meeples in Great Britain, build cities and influence the course of important roads. There are also new ways to score points, e.g. by winning the scoring of a big city or by connecting streets to neighboring countries.

The map consists of high-quality, strong, linen-embossed paper and has the size A1.

—description from the publisher

Name: Carcassonne Maps: Península Ibérica
Description:
With Carcassonne Maps we offer you a new possibility to play Carcassonne. With Carcassonne Maps: Iberian Peninsula you can use your tiles and meeples in Iberia, build cities and influence the course of important roads. There are also new ways to score points, e.g. by winning the scoring of a big city or by connecting streets to neighbouring countries.

The map consists of high-quality, strong, linen-embossed paper and has the size A1.

—description from the publisher

Name: Carcassonne: The Tollkeepers
Description:
In the Middle Ages, customs law gave land owners the right to impose an import duty or toll on passing travelers and traders. A distinction was sometimes made between "small customs" (mainly for the use of a means of transport) and "large customs", which was levied on goods depending on the type and weight.

All of this can be found in Carcassonne: The Tollkeepers (Die Zöllner), with players being able to raise customs on travelers and goods to earn points.

Name: Carcassonne Maps: Chips
Description:
With Carcassonne Maps: Chips we offer you a new possibility to play Carcassonne Maps! With Carcassonne Maps: Chips you can use your Maps in a completely new way. There are also new ways to score points, e.g. by winning the scoring of a big city or by connecting streets to neighbouring countries.

For every Map we offer different rules and you can use your Chips for every Map!

—description from the publisher

Name: ArcWorlde: Troubles in the North
Description:
ArcWorlde is freezing in a sorcerous winter. Warbands, monsters and heroes clash in ArcWorlde: Troubles in the North - the first expansion of the 32mm tabletop fantasy skirmish wargame from Warploque Miniatures.

Introducing three new Factions, new models to add to your existing ArcWorlde warbands, fearsome monsters from the frozen North and new characters and heroes to join your forces,  ArcWorlde: Troubles in the North has something for both existing players, and those new to the game.

With almost 150 pages of art and lore to immerse yourself in, as well as characterful hand-sculpted miniatures to awaken your imagination, bring the frozen lands of Njorsvald to life on your table top.

Name: Hostage Negotiator: Abductor Pack 9
Description:
Misha Koskiken is the poster child for sensationalism gone wrong in the best of times, but today things spiraled out of control. Her opponents snuck into an event and threatened her, so she incited her loyal devotees to violence. Now you have to interject between these two groups before things spiral further out of control.

In this thrilling new expansion for Hostage Negotiator, the Abductor isn't getting her own hands dirty, she has a flock of loyal fans to do it for her. You'll have to manage her petty tendencies and keep her paranoia in check before she ends up igniting this powder keg.

—description from the publisher

This Abductor pack is a 15 card expansion compatible with both Hostage Negotiator and Hostage Negotiator: Crime Wave.

Name: Hostage Negotiator: Abductor Pack 10
Description:
Inc0gn1t0 is a threat unlike any you've faced. Their identity and location are unknown, as are their demands. What is known is that they've hacked into networks across the city and we've found traces of a bomb that has some sort of remote access code. Can you stop them in time?

In this new expansion pack for Hostage Negotiator, you must deal with Inc0gn1t0's reign of terror across the city while trying to decrypt the code for the bomb. The more hostages you save the more time you buy for the decryption, but is it enough?

—description from the publisher

This Abductor pack is a 15 card expansion compatible with both Hostage Negotiator and Hostage Negotiator: Crime Wave.

Name: ArcWorlde: Battle For Troll Bridge
Description:
"News of a Bayourk warband plaguing the Hobbleshire town of Milwood summon a garrisoned Albionnican warband accompanied by the local Halfling Militia. They find the villainous Bayourk tribe taking residence upon the infamous Troll Bridge, spoiling for a fight.

However, on hearing a mighty roar, the local Halflings shake with fear, for they know how the bridge earned it’s name. Old Grogg, the largest River Troll ever seen, emerges from beneath, and he is not happy that his slumber has been disturbed..."

'Battle for Troll Bridge' is a four player starter box for the 32mm fantasy Skirmish game 'ArcWorlde'.

This box set contains -

Five new Albionnican Empire miniatures – Captain Flynt (Special Character) , a Halberdier Trooper, two Crossbow Troopers and a Lowlander (new Albionnican unit). Cast in white metal.

Six new Halfling miniatures – Captain Bullhoof (Special Character), one Spear Militia, one Sword Militia and three Rangers (new Halfling unit). Cast in white metal.

Five new Bayourk miniatures – “Mad-Eye” Muldoon (Special Character), three Boglins and a Brew Boy (new Bayourk unit). Bayourks cast in fine resin, Boglins cast in white metal.

A new monstrous miniature - Old Grogg the River Troll (Special Character). Cast in fine resin.

The full ArcWorlde Rulebook.

A 20 page Battle for Troll Bridge rules booklet with stats for the new miniatures, scenarios and pictures of the models.

10 ArcWorlde Dice and 10 Arcanite Tokens

All packaged within a beautiful foam-lined and scratch resistant game box.

Name: Hostage Negotiator: Demand Pack #2
Description:
An entire pack of 16 all-new cards to use with the abductors featured in Crime Wave (Barrett, Lijah, and Renesha), as well as abductors in Abductor Packs #5-8 (Cult of Automa, the Seavers, Valerie Stone, and Sammy X)! Just like Demand Pack #1, this will bring a whole new challenge to abductors you've faced in the past!

—description from the publisher

Name: Hostage Negotiator: Career – Secret Cabal Year Zero Promo Card
Description: This is a special Year 0 Career card that was offered to backers of the Secret Cabal Kickstarter campaign.

Name: Hostage Negotiator: Career – Alternate Finale Pack #2
Description:
The second Alternate Finale Pack, providing a completely different ending to your Career experience!

—description from the publisher

14 additional cards for Hostage Negotiator: Career

Name: Hostage Negotiator: Career – Stretch Goal Pack
Description:
This pack includes the following items:

     5 Year Zero Promo Cards
     2 Career Negotiator promo cards
     1 Frustration Die
     4 custom meeples
     Finale Pack #1
     a new divider pack
     Abductor Rulebook #2


—description from the publisher

Name: Hostage Negotiator: Career – Negotiator Cards
Description:
The Hater and The Chief Negotiator Cards.

The Hater
A cynical veteran of the force that has seen one too many hostage situations.

The Chief
The Chief is an important character who will appear throughout your Career campaign. Now you can take on a hostage situation with her in the driver’s seat.

Decide before the game begins if you would like to use a Negotiator card. You may select one of your choice or shuffle and take one at random.
Each Negotiator card has a special ability that can only be used ONCE during the game.

—description from the publisher

Name: Slyville: Jester's Gambit
Description:
Medieval cities were home to very different types of people. Not only pious monks, humble scholars and trustworthy merchants, but also those mischievous, cunning and dishonest. Welcome to the city of Slyville, where you become one of the latter kind! As head of a guild operating in one of the world's major trade and cultural centers in the Middle Ages, you will be sending your trusted henchmen to various districts to find trade bargains, make deals, and provide your organization with more power and wealth — maybe not always in a way that is completely legal, but the end justifies the means, doesn’t it? After all, you want to get in the graces of the Prince, right?

The Jester’s Gambit expansion introduces two new types of cards: Events and Hidden Agendas, to spice up the struggle of the guild leaders in the slyest of all medieval cities! Select your secret goals to pursue, and experience most unusual events: pirates looting the city, a fire in the library, or an audience with the Prince himself - read out a paragraph from the The Book of Slyville Chronicles and see what happens.

—description from the publisher

Name: Krümelmonster
Description:
Math Game for children to learn counting and calculating up to 13.

The Game consists of 2x 36 cards with 1-13 Monsters or Numbers on it. Every Player plays one card and tries to reach a total of 13 monsters which is rewarded by one point. If you cannot play a card because you would get over 13 you need to take one card from the pile. Winner is the firat player to get 13 points.

There are also 3 rule variants included:

     You can use Monster and Number cards
     You try to get pairs of Monster and Number cards with the same value
     You try to get triples of same cards, either all Monsters are all Numbers


—user summary

Name: EverZone: Hilga Promo Card
Description:
Unit Vermin Queen

15 Resources required to have this card active on the battlefield.

You can place one unit of the opponent's army that you just destroyed into your retreated pile until the end of the game.

9 Attack
4 Defense
4 Range

Name: The Kevin Bloody Wilson Bar Krawl
Description:
Race other players round town on your bar kraawl, stopping for a drink at your favorite watering holes on the way.
Pick up a Kev Kard and face the challenge - or pay the penalty impress your friends with your balancing skills! Get your tongue around a limerick! sing a few bars of your favorite Kev Klassic.

—description from the back of the box

Name: Host Your Own Christmas Games
Description:
Festive fun for family and friends!
Bring an extra dose of chear and laughter to your household this Christmas - by inviting your friends and family to play a hilarious round of party games in addition to the "12 games of Christmas" there are race games party games observation games and games to drive you crackers!

Whether you're having a sneak peek in "Santa's Sack", annoying the neigbours with your "Karaoke Carols" or quietly humming tunes in "Bah! Hummbug" you'll  soon succumb to the Christmas Spirit!

Packed on the audio CD there are challenging trials, trivia quizzes, musical fun and games to play against the clock! Come on... work of those extra calories, switch off the telly and amuse eachother with some good old-fashioned home entertainment!

—description from the back of the box

Name: Too Too Catch
Description:
Hey, dear locomotive, where are you going, what do you carry? Connect colorful wagons to each other in a row, grab the longest train and take it to your garage. More wagons – more funny way to victory: too-too, adventure trip begins!

The board game, which itself can be categorized as funny involving educational game, has lots of playful and educational elements – attentiveness, ability to distinguish colors, perception of relationships between identical objects. Simple and memorable rules make it easy to play and evaluate as super gift for both, the child and the adult.

Content: 3 cards of locomotives, 30 cards of wagons, 3 dices, 3 STOP signals

Name: Ethan Allen's Manager's Supplement to All-Star Baseball
Description:
While very similar to All-Star Baseball, Ethan Allen saw it as a different game rather than an expansion or 'supplement' in that it was more strategically involved and more sophisticated than the original game. New material was incompatible with the original game.

Description of All-Star Baseball:

signed by former major league player Ethan Allen and introduced in 1941, All-Star Baseball became one of the most popular sports games of all time. The game is essentially a batting simulation of major league baseball, built around a spinner and player disks that are divided into sections in such a manner that a hitter has the probabiltyi of reproducing his real-life statistics in such important categories as home runs, triples, doubles, singles, walks, and strikeouts. In general, the game follows the basic rules of major league baseball. Teams are created from the player disks supplied with the game (often a mix of current players and all-time greats such as Babe Ruth) and from player disks for other seasons published separately. The team at bats places the appropriate player disk on the spinner, spins, and reads off the resulting number. The game does not attempt to realistically simulate pitching and defense. Thus a hitter's result from a time at bat is not affected by the opposing pitcher or the defensive prowess of the fielder to whom the ball may be hit, although the player in the field on some play outcomes is required to spin a second spinner to determine the advancement of base runners and other certain details. Results of each play are recorded on the field using plastic pegs for the base runners, while runs and outs are tallied on a rotating scoreboard. Cumulative runs scored are tallied on paper score sheets. Strategy discs are included that enable plays like sacrifice flies, stealing bases, bunting, hit and run, etc. The team with the most runs after nine innings (or extra innings, if needed) is the winner.

Name: Arkham Horror: The Card Game – Dark Side of the Moon: Mythos Pack
Description:
"All life is only a set of pictures in the brain, among which there is no difference betwixt those born of real things and those born of inward dreamings..." –H. P. Lovecraft, "The Silver Key"

Embark on a dangerous rescue mission in Dark Side of the Moon, the third Mythos Pack in The Dream-Eaters cycle for Arkham Horror: The Card Game! After the man who may hold the key to escaping the Dreamlands is taken by dangerous Corsairs, you follow to a dead world where danger is waiting around every corner. But will you be able to rescue your charge and escape without raising the alarm?

Dark Side of the Moon can be played on its own in Standalone Mode or combined with the other expansions in The Dream-Eaters cycle to form a larger four-part or eight-part campaign. After the events of The Search for Kadath, the investigators in the Dreamlands are drawn even further from the world of the waking than they could have ever thought when Virgil Gray is taken to the cold, distant moon and you have no choice but to follow in the hopes of rescuing him. You must remain even quieter in order to stay hidden long enough to rescue Virgil and escape.

—description from the publisher
Families: Game: Arkham Horror – The Card Game
Game: Arkham Horror TCG – The Dream-Eaters
Series: Arkham Horror Files (Fantasy Flight Games)

Name: Call to Adventure: Name of the Wind – Friends & Mentors Kickstarter Exclusive Card Pack
Description: Kickstarter backers also received the "Path of the Adem" cards (Warrior, Lethani, and Wise Master).

Name: Exploitation
Description:
It is the Turn Of The Century — The 17th Century, that is. World explorers have discovered new lands, and the race is on to discover what new valuables and resources await those who manage to hold onto the claim. Wars and rumors of war continuously occur across the old Continent, and everyone’s looking for an edge.

But these new lands, much of it is already populated by unknown peoples with strange customs. No matter… perhaps they can be convinced to become an asset for us, or be forcibly removed. Maybe these inhabitants should just be left alone in peace, much like so many wish for their own here at home. But the continuous undertow of world supremacy rages on, and all are caught in her current.

This is where you find yourself today: Will you sit back peacefully and leave to chance your country’s rise to dominance on the self-destruction of the others, or will you dive right in and grab what you can of what the New World has to offer, using that tried and true technique: Exploitation.

Exploitation is a 4x game (3.5x essentially), whereby players manage their resources to navigate the world, founding/conquering settlements and using them to reap more resources. In turn, they can be used for exploring farther regions, building stronger armadas, battling other players, enlisting the help of Privateers, and otherwise trying to be the nation with the highest prestige in the historical setting of the Colonial Era. In the course of play, players are also confronted with the moral complications of the slave trade and the plight of indigenous native populations of the New World.

—description from the publisher

Name: Formace
Description:
Formace is a chess-like game in which two armies fight to capture one of the two opponent's Overlords.

The playing board is a 12x12 checkered board which is divided into 3x3 quadrants. The quadrants are essential for game strategy.

The game is named after the formations which can be created by lined up Pawns. All Pawns in a "formation" can be moved together in one single turn.

Each player has 14 Pawns - the weakest units but able to create formations, 2 Executioners - opponents' units can not move if they are in the same quadrant, 2 Chieftains - leaders of formations and 2 Overlords - strong in movement but a game is lost when one of them is captured.

—user summary

Name: Belapati War
Description:
Nusantara, 14th Century ..

Jawadwipa burned. Two unequal forces met on the battlefield. If before, Sunda thought that eventually it would end up with happiness, they must face the bitterness of seeing everything turn into disaster. King Linggabuana and Princess Dyah Pitaloka were astonished to see what was happening before their eyes. Majapahit besieged with complete weapons ready to melt Sunda. Gajah Mada wants Sunda to bow in Majapahit's lap. King Hayam Wuruk couldn't resist Sunda still hold fast the soul of the knights they have. Bela Pati is the only way they choose. They fought to protect their pride. They fought for the sake of their kingdom pride. They fought for the sake of the kstaria they have. They fought even though they knew it would all be ashes. They fought to the point of death.

After all there is nothing left, Princess Dyah Pitaloka chose to sacrifice herself in order to protect the pride of her kingdom. Even the King Hayam Wuruk was sad, his loved one is gone. But the spirit of struggle of the two kingdom countries teaches us, that what we dream of is worth fighting for until it becomes a reality.
Inspired by how the courage of the Sunda to fight against Majapahit, Bela Pati Boardgame was created. Aside from being a media for education of the dark history of the people of Indonesia, This board game will also take you to feel how the soul of  “ksatria”  in each step you choose burn in your heart. 
Choose the kingdom that you will play. Mighty Majapahit, or Brave Sunda. Find the path to victory to maintain the dignity and spirit of the knights of Nusantara.

The warrior pawns moves 4 directions while the king pawn moves 8 directions. There are change direction boxes and secret card boxes. If the pawn on the change direction box, then the pawn of the player has the right to change direction according to the available arrows. If it is in the secret card box, then the player has the right to take the card provided. victory can be achieved by spending all the opponent's pawns.

Name: Two Kingdoms
Description: Game about fighting for domination between two kingdoms which will win each other's Domination of Religion, War, Technology and Culture by recruiting their citizens. In this game the two players compete quickly to complete the existing conditions in one of domination (war, religion, culture and technology) by recruiting Citizens who are behind the opponent's card by paying the Coin card in the hand in accordance with the request.

Name: Laga Pendekar
Description:
Laga Pendekar is a card game that invites all players to play & feel the simulation of Pencak Silat competition easily & fun. While playing, the players can get to know some of Pencak Silat techniques and style from the existing game components. This game aims to become a champion by reaching 15 points first. The unique part of this game is 5 characters with different abilities. Each character consists of 3 Style cards. This Style Card is used to attack to get points (without being able to strike back with a regular action card) or just defend (other options if there is no action card to counter other action cards).

However, if this style card is reversed, then it functions to be a Foul card. Used to counter actions, so that opponents can be deducted points.

—user summary

Name: Luwenak
Description:
The game setting is a restaurant that serves traditional Indonesian foods. One day, The Chef falls ill and cannot continue the business. The players are the children of The Chef, competing against each other to inherit the business and carry on the legacy. Be the savior and prove that you can be the best successor in the family! In Luwenak!, players collect as many Customer Cards and Food Tokens as possible. The winner is the first to reach 15 points.
 Players have color tokens that they exchange for matching Ingredient Cards. Then players combine their Ingredient Cards to make recipes represented by food tokens, having various point values. Players also gain points by matching food tokens with a customer's favorite food.

Name: Prabumeru
Description: Welcome to the climbing area! As a novice climber, the climb begins from the easiest to the hardest climbing level, by passing several climbing posts and cannot easily achieve it, some obstacle that must be passed by climbers. By using a climbing information and PIN token it will be easier to reach the peak. Prabumeru is a board game with a theme nature especially mount on java island. Prabumeru is the name taken from mount prau, Mount Merbabu, and mount semeru. The game starts from basecamp Patak Banteng - Selo - Ranu Pane, players must pass each path until they pass the ascent post. Collect as many coins as possible and get a PIN token when in a special area to make it easier to climb. This game is very fun when players get obstacle and penalties. The game is finished  when the player is at the highest peak of mahameru. Feel the excitement on every trip!

Name: Bam Bam Aksara Jawa
Description:
Bam-Bam and friends found an old book full of Aksara Jawa. But they don’t know how to read Aksara Jawa at all. Let’s help Bam-Bam and friends to read every phrase of the book! You don’t need to know any Aksara Jawa to play this game. But, you might learn one or two Aksara Jawa after play this game!

In every turn players have to arrange Aksara Jawa Tiles as stated on the Target Cards. The quickest one gains the victory points. Game ends when all of Phrase Cards are accomplished. Player with the highest victory points is the winner!

Name: War of the Words
Description:
War of the Words is one of word board game that emphasizing on finding most possible words while attacking other opponents and pursuing word bonuses. Purchase letters or special cards, play a word or the special card, sell your letters, and try to add bonus scores while learning words.

Each turn, player may purchase a letter or a card, playing a word with combo special cards effect, without throwing away letters after used. Your letters can be used to play as many as possible words and you may sell them to get new letters.

Name: Mindblowon
Description:
Avoid the Bomb! Survive this deck full of Bombs and other hazardous instructions while players push each other to the brink of explosion! Say your prayer and utilize the unique double-sided Action/Ability cards to increase your survival chance to be the last player alive and become the Mindblowon champion!

Just flip a top card face-up from two available decks & perform the instruction. If you survive the round, take all opened cards (alongside its awesome ability on its flip-side) to use on your next turn. The game continues until one player survives, while others were blown to smithereens!

—description from the publisher

Name: The Forbidden Ritual
Description:
The moon beckons and the night is ripe! Perform the traditional black magic ritual of Santet to eliminate other shamans by rolling the dice, performing the forbidden ritual, enlisting the help from supernatural bloodthirsty demons, all to claim the glory to become the most feared black magic wielder from Nusantara!

The active player rolls 5 dice in Yahtzee fashion to accumulate certain desired symbols while balancing their shared Spell/Rage tracker that must not overlap; the spell is accumulated slowly to perform the ritual whilst bursts of Rage is needed to flip their double-sided Shaman card to the enraged form.

When a player lost their last Life token the game immediately ends and each player tally their accumulated points in form of Life tokens obtained from their enemies plus their remaining Life tokens' quantity.

Name: Rebels & Redcoats: Volume III Compilation Edition
Description:
This three volume set uses the exact same box,artwork, and description as Volume III.  It was sold as a special edition that included all three series game sets in one box.  The ONLY differentiation is the Gold Sticker that mentions the additional content.

Nineteen battles from the American War of Independence are included.

The easy game system recreates battlefield conditions with a move-fight-rally play sequence to simulate the grand tactics of these battles. Additional rules include command control, morale, artillery, light infantry, and dragoons. Each battle is represented by its own units and map along with exclusive rules to recreate the unique battlefield situation. Units are generally regiments, and rated for combat strength, morale, and march capabilities.

Famous leaders are also included-Washington, Howe, Greene, and Knyphausen. Battles range from Bunker Hill, through Brooklyn and Trenton, to Saratoga and Monmouth, and on to the South at Cowpens, Guilford, and King's Mountain.

Major battles:

     Bunker Hill (17 June 1775)
     Brandywine (11 September 1777)
     Germantown (4 October 1777)
     Monmouth (28 June 1778)


 
Saratoga Campaign:

     Bennington (16 August 1777)
     Freeman's Farm (first Saratoga - 19 september 1777)
     Bemis Heights (second Saratoga - 7 October 1777)


 
Southern Campaign:

     Camden (16 August 1780)
     Cowpens (17 January 1781)
     Guilford Court House (15 March 1781)
     Hobkirk's Hill (Second Battle of Camden - 25 April 1781)
     Eutaw Springs (8 September 1781)


 
New York Campaign:

        Brooklyn (27 Aug 1776)
        Harlem Heights (16 Sep 1776)
        White Plains (28 Oct 1776)


 
New Jersey Campaign:

        Trenton (26 Dec 1776)
        Princeton (3 Jan 1777)


 
Two other scenarios:

        Stony Point (16 Jul 1779)
        King's Mountain (7 Oct 1780) 


(description adapted from all three volumes descriptions, added information)

Name: Apocalypse Run
Description:
Welcome to Mint City, welcome to the Apocalypse!

The inevitable apocalypse has arrived and you find yourself holed-up in Mint City.
As our intrepid hero you must leave the safety of the Secure Zone and brave the zombie-infested streets to find the components of a highly experimental and almost definitely feasible Z-Bomb.

You'll start out with nothing but your wits, and you'll need them as you dodge zombies and keep moving around the city to find your objectives.

Along the way you'll find Items and Ammo to help you in your quest and return safely to potentially perchance save Mint City.

—description from the designer

Name: Bottletop Chicks
Description:
In Bottletop Chicks, competitors play for their country—and their corporate sponsors—in a futuristic aerial combat game that marries brutality with brilliance.

Two to four players attempt to avoid or counter attacks from their opponent(s) while delivering maximum damage of their own in the arena (represented by a 7x7 playing board). Players have identical decks from which to select their moves, so a player’s success relies upon their ability to anticipate opponents’ maneuvers while disguising their own.

In other words? It’s just your typical stock-car-racing-meets-MMA-meets-chess throwdown with a little patriotic pride thrown in for good measure.

—description from the publisher

Name: The Fantasy Trip: Death Test and Death Test 2
Description:
The mighty Thorsz is hiring guards. But the test is a killer. You have to make it through his labyrinth full of traps, monsters, and other would-be guards!

These adventures can be played by a single player or a group of up to four. You can even play with a GM, but you don’t need one . . . these are “programmed adventures” that take you through the labyrinth. Your choices – and whether you conquer or flee – determine what paragraph you go to next. Until you succeed, gaining rewards and honor . . . or lose.

Losers die.

Death Test is 24 pages of murderous goodness. Death Test 2, the sequel, is twice as long and at least twice as deadly. These games use the Melee map and the Melee and Wizard rules.

—description from the publisher
Families: Series: The Fantasy Trip (Steve Jackson Games)

Name: Kamuzol! (vagy nem?)
Description:
Everybody lies. This is especially true of your camouflage! (or not?) board game, where you have to choose from the statements you read, the Kam, ie the fake. Someone is always dumb, roles are constantly changing, where you have to guess and where to lie. Get your poker face up, build your inner lie detector, start the game! Uncover most liars and victory is yours! The statements on the cards are based on your knowledge, but the way the game is read is greatly influenced by the gameplay. Be alert, lie wisely, read between the lines!

Everyone used to lie sometimes, and this is also true for this game. Because of the statements you have to make, you have to decide what is true and what is not. Someone will always lie, and sometime you have to lie and then guess. Try to stay calm so your teammates won't notice when you're lying and when you're not. Be smart and be careful you never know and when you lie !!

Name: Moonstone: Two Player Starter Set
Description:
This 2-player Starter set contains everything you need to start playing Moonstone.

Contains:


     4 Human Miniatures made in fine quality resin with bases and stat cards: Baron von Fancyhat, Eric the Squire, Flintlock, and Friar Flavius  (Starter set exclusive!)
     4 Goblin Miniatures made in fine quality resin with bases and stat cards: Doug the Flatulent, Beaky Bobby, Vicious Midget, Grub (Starter set exclusive!)
     1 Moonstone Card Deck
     1 Rules Pamphlet
     30 Blue Energy Counters
     7 4-Sided Dice
     2 6-Sided Dice
     1 Moonstone Measuring Widget


Miniatures are multipart and require assembly.

Name: Happy Nation
Description:
Happy Nation is a game where players try to become the happiest player by deciding each turn on how to spend their time and money. In this game, happiness is the collection of all your joyful experiences.

Each of the 5 characters produces unique items, which the other players can buy to achieve their goals. In addition to time and money management for actions, the setting of prices and convincing other players to buy your items or to work more is an important element.

Players identify quickly with the real-life theme and one of the 5 characters: Builder, Farmer, Entertainer, Banker or Doctor.

The game brings all elements for a 1-2 hour playing experience, with the right mix of strategy, luck and interaction.

As a bonus you might learn how bank loans function in our societies.

—description from the designer

Name: Head for Glory
Description:
Head for Glory is a fast-paced arena fighting-game set in an alternate-reality of ancient Rome, where headless Romans compete for the right to rule the empire as the new Caesar.

Each player enters the fight headless and has to choose out of a pool of 9 different heads, each with a unique ability or attack modifier. But the powers you choose may change by the swing of a sword. As you get decapitated you lose your powers and have to re-evaluate your strategy by changing heads.

When entering the final stage of the fight, Caesar's head enters the arena and grants the bearer special abilities. The fighter who can defend the head while not being decapitated, wins the game.

Determine your fighting style by enhancing your character traits. Your style will evolve during combat as you get to know the benefits of each trait and how to combine your abilities. Plan your attacks by moving on the hex-grid and by creating synergies of card-based abilities combined with your head abilities.

Expand your tableau and build your dice-pool. Draft your abilities, choose your fighting style and master each matchup as you play.

Name: Battlebetes
Description:
Outwit your friends with pharmacy finesse, daring diet and exercise, noble nutrition and lifestyle choices while avoiding terrible temptations given to you by your friends.  Strategize how to get the best blood sugar score and earn the admiration of your family, friends, and general practitioner.  Pit yourself against other diabetic warriors in the ultimate battle of diabetes management, Battlebetes.
—description from the publisher

Battlebetes is a card drafting and scoring game played in three rounds where each round each player is trying to be the closest to 100.  Each round has two parts: “Drafting Cards” and “Throwing and Scoring”.  The player with the highest score after three rounds wins. The first part is a "draft and pass" dynamic like "sushi go" and "7 wonders".  This leaves players with five important choices that will ultimately decide their chances of winning.  Do you: stack one card or balance cards, directly attack others or choose a card just to prevent another from getting it, save it for later or spend now? In the scoring phase each player throws their resulting food tokens like dice (each side has a number) adding any modifiers obtained resulting in their round score.

Name: Think Words! Spin
Description:
Think Words! Spin is the fun, fast-paced game which is simple to play – spin it, name it, take it!
How to Play
There are 7 ways to play Think Words Spin, here’s one of them…

     Spin…the spinner until it stops.
     Match…the colour to select the category and letter.
     Shout…out the answer first to win the card!


—description from the publisher

Name: I Am: Celebrity Edition
Description:
This game could not be any easier to play.  Throw the dice and the "famous person" will give you a clue to their identity based on the number of the dice - throw a six and will even get the name you are looking for!

—description from the publisher

Name: Pokemon TCG: Storm Caller Theme Deck
Description:
The Storm Caller Theme Deck from the Lost Thunder expansion of the Pokémon Trading Card Game predominantly focuses on Lightning type Pokémon. The main Pokémon is Raikou.

Like other Theme Decks, Storm Caller includes damage counters, a custom coin, one two-player mat, a Raikou deckbox and a TCGO deck access code.

Name: Exo-Hex
Description:
Exo-Hex is played using black and white stones and a “hexhex” board (a hexagonal-shaped board made of hexagonal cells).  For the setup, on the exterior of the board, just outside of each of its six sides, equal and alternating strings of the two colors (one black string, one white string) are placed.  These exterior stones are known as the "exo-stones."

On each turn, a player places a single stone of his/her own color into any empty cell; once placed, stones never move. Play continues until the board is full or both players pass, at which point the game is scored. Any group of own-color stones has a score equal to the number of "exo-stones" that it contains.  The owner of the highest scoring group wins.

If there is a tie for highest scoring group, then the tied groups are set aside and the remaining groups are compared; the owner of the highest scoring group among the remaining groups wins. If these groups are also tied, then the process is repeated (that is, the tied groups are set aside and the remaining groups compared) until a winner results.  (It is impossible for group scores to be tied “all the way down.”)

The “Pie Rule” applies:  After Player 1 plays the first stone to the board, Player 2 can decide whether to play his/her own color to the board, or alternatively, switch colors with Player 1.  (The purpose of this rule is to offset the first player advantage: if Player 1 plays too strong of an opening move, then a rational Player 2 will decide to switch colors and make the just-played stone his/her opening move.)

—description from the designer

Name: Ambush at Rannungen:  A 1985 MBT Scenario
Description:
NOTE:  This game is no longer for sale.

***All briefings and maps can be downloaded from the files section of this page for free.  The maps should be printed on 12 x 18 inch paper to produce an 11 x 17 inch map.***

Ambush at Rannugen depicts a never fought 1985 engagement in the Fulda Gap using Jim Day's and GMT’s MBT Game pitting a reinforced US tank company team of the 1st Infantry Division (Forward) against a reinforced Warsaw Pact Motorized Rifle Battalion in Germany.

The scenario reflects my experience as a Company Commander in 1984-1985  The game explores a way to use terrain in a different manner to defeat the enemy.  In a conventional defense, the US establishes a killing zone by positioning on good terrain with frontal and flank shots to destroy the enemy once he enters the zone.  Here, the tactic is to position the US force in such a manner that he is rewarded with shots on the enemy's rear and flanks while at the same time perhaps avoiding some of the enemy's artillery bombardment.  The dicey part, however, is withdrawing and getting to a new position after finishing the engagement.

Like other scenarios I have released, it is not balanced although players may balance it as they deem fit.

To play the game, you must have a copy of the initial GMT MBT Game. The expansion includes 4 11 x 17 maps scaled at 100 meters per hex (the same scale as the MBT game), a Scenario Briefing, a US Battle Book and a Soviet Battle book with deployment instructions and order of battle listing, and a terrain key. The map is based on a period map of the battle area and utilizes contours to depict elevation.

Expansion sets are not required (BAOR, FRG, and the forthcoming Canadian supplement) provide additional vehicle counters as well as leaders. A list of substitute counters is provided to enable the player to field the complete order of battle for both sides or the players can use some of the expansion set vehicles or combine sets to complete the order of battle.

Rannugen can be played with two players but may be more interesting if played with up to 4 players on the US side (CO and the five platoon leaders), and 5 on the USSR side (Battalion Commander and 4 company commanders), and a referee.

—description from the designer

Name: Special Ops Issue #9
Description:
Special Ops #9 consists of several articles, ASL/ASLSK scenarios, and the full game Greater East Asia Co-Prosperity Sphere, designed by Yasushi Nakaguro and originally published by BonSai Games.

The game covers war, diplomacy, and politics in the Asia-Pacific theater, with one-year turns beginning in 1939 and ending in 1944. The game has one map, eight pages of rules, one player aid card, 24 cards, and 50 1" counters.

Featured articles:


     ABOUT THE GAME - Front Toward Enemy by Joe Chacon
     SCENARIO CHRONOLOGY - Great Campaigns of the American Civil War by Kenneth Oates
     ASL STARTER KIT #4 - Pacific Theater of Operations by Kevin G. Boles
     ASL STARTER KIT #4 - Sequence of Play by Multi-Man Publishing
     ASL STARTER SET - Hedge Rules examples of play by Multi-Man Publishing
     CONSCRIPTS IN RED FACTORIES - One Man's Treasure by Vincent Maresca
     OCS 101 - Smolensk: Barbarossa Derailed by Chip Saltsman
     DESIGNER'S PREVIEW - VCS Kharkov by Greg Blanchett


ASL/ASLSK Scenarios:


     ASLSK Scenario S72 - Stretched Thin at Altavilla, Americans vs Germans
     ASLSK Scenario S73 - West of the Vire, Americans vs Germans
     ASL Scenario O17 - White Russians, Americans vs Germans
     ASL Scenario O18 - Purple Heart Hill, Americans vs Germans
Families: Game: Advanced Squad Leader Starter Kit

Name: ComPetAbility
Description:
The Pet Matching Game for Kids of All Ages!

54 character adoptable animal pet cards for 100’s of combinations
Great family game for ages 7+.
Easier game rules for kids under age 7!
Match the characters by type and personality.
Easy, fun to read character descriptions.
Easy to follow match-up icons.
Keep track of points from multiple rounds for hours of fun!

The object of Com-Pet-Ability is to find five animal characters who are Com-Pet-Able so you can take them home and win the hand! Each Animal Character has its own personality and traits that make them more, or less, Com-Pet-Able with other Animal Characters.

A player needs to get five completely Com-Pet-Able Animal Characters in their hand to make the adoption and end the round! Play multiple rounds to keep the game going, adding more points as you go!

Name: ASL Action Pack #14: ASL Oktoberfest XXXIV
Description:
Following on the success of the two previous ASL Oktoberfest packs, ASLOK XXXIV takes a deep dive into the battles in France throughout Normandy and Brittany in the late spring and summer of 1944. From D-Day to the Falaise Pocket to the drive on Brest, these 12 scenarios explore the fierce fighting engaged in by the infantry, armor, and mechanized cavalry of the American, British, and Canadian forces attacking (and being counterattacked by) a wide range of German defenders, primarily fallschirmjäger and elite SS forces. The scenarios are created by veteran designers Pete Shelling, Bill Sisler, and Ted Wilcox and developed under the guidance of veteran playtesters and tournament directors Bret Hildebran and Bill Hayward. These scenarios will stretch your tactical knowledge and skills, with many different situations. Bocage features heavily (but far from exclusively). There is one night paradrop scenario, and one is an assault on a fortified gun battery, but none of the scenarios uses offboard artillery. Several scenarios feature combined arms on both sides, several more combined arms on only one side, and several are infantry only.

Two new boards were designed specifically for this pack and feature significantly in its scenarios. Board 84 features a large hill mass next to a small village with many hedges, numerous orchards, and scattered woods conveying a very claustrophobic rural terrain. Board 12a/b features a larger village with stone buildings partially surrounded by a board-length gully, with orchards, grainfields, and hedges throughout. Both boards show off the skill of artist Charlie Kibler. With great boards and great scenarios, Action Pack #14 is sure to be a winner.

Name: Wildflowers
Description:
The meadows are a riot of color, alive with the buzzing of insects, and it’s the best time to collect a beautiful summer bouquet. Can you gather the most stylish flowers? Wildflowers is a 3- to 8-player card game of drafting and set collection played over three rounds.

Each round, players will simultaneously keep a growing portion of their hand, passing the rest along, constructing the most valuable bouquet. In addition to scoring for the composition of their final bouquet, players also compete to be the most stylish, with bonus points awarded for key traits and combinations. 9 different types of flower cards may be mixed and matched, allowing for variety in gameplay.

Rules variants allow for a competitive 2-player version of the game, without the need for drafting, as well as a solitaire puzzle game using the same cards and scoring.

—description from the designer

Name: Blitz Bowl: Skaven Team
Description:
Blitz Bowl is a fast paced sports game that pits two teams against each other in a battle to achieve touchdowns, complete Challenges and score the most Points! The Skaven Team expansion provides everything necessary for use with Blitz Bowl, including cards, bases and a full sprue with Player figures, Coin, Score Marker and Balls.

There are 6 Skaven figures in brown plastic, all with unique sculpts:

1x Thrower
1x Blitzer
1x Gutter Runner
3x Lineman

One card is provided for each type; assembly instructions included.

—description from the publisher

Name: Blitz Bowl: Chaos Team
Description:
Blitz Bowl is a fast paced sports game that pits two teams against each other in a battle to achieve touchdowns, complete Challenges and score the most Points! The Chaos Team expansion provides everything necessary for use with Blitz Bowl, including cards, bases and a full sprue with Player figures, Coin, Score Marker and Balls.

There are 6 Chaos figures in orange plastic, all with unique sculpts:

2x Blocker
4x Beastman Runner

One card is provided for each type; assembly instructions included.

—description from the publisher

Name: Blitz Bowl: Halfling Team
Description:
Blitz Bowl is a fast paced sports game that pits two teams against each other in a battle to achieve touchdowns, complete Challenges and score the most Points! The Halfling Team expansion provides everything necessary for use with Blitz Bowl, including cards, bases and a full sprue with Player figures, Coin, Score Marker and Balls.

There are 6 Halfling figures in green plastic, all with unique sculpts:

1x Hefty
2x Runner
3x Hopeful

One card is provided for each type; assembly instructions included.

—description from the publisher

Name: Blitz Bowl: Undead Team
Description:
Blitz Bowl is a fast paced sports game that pits two teams against each other in a battle to achieve touchdowns, complete Challenges and score the most Points! The Undead Team expansion provides everything necessary for use with Blitz Bowl, including cards, bases and a full sprue with Player figures, Coin, Score Marker and Balls.

There are 7 Undead figures in bone colored plastic, all with unique sculpts:

1x Mummy
1x Wight Blitzer
1x Ghoul
2x Skeleton
2x Zombie

One card is provided for each type; assembly instructions included.

—description from the publisher

Name: Duel 52
Description:
A free two-player card game which uses a standard deck of cards.

Duel 52 is a game of board control and tempo. The board is divided into three opposing lanes, where both players fight for control.

Players take turns drawing cards, playing cards into lanes, using powers and attacking the opponents board.

The game ends when a player wins two lanes. A lane is won by killing all opposing cards in that lane.

—description from the designer

Name: Space Maze Puzzle Game
Description:
Space Maze Puzzle Game is a cube shape puzzle with 64 interconnected cubical zones. The objective is for players to place a metal ball in an opening and then rotate the cube and navigate the ball through a path to an opening at the other end.

Once the puzzle is solved the instructions suggest trying a short way, improving the time to complete the maze and even doing it blindfolded!

Made in Australia during the 1950's for a company called Space Maze distributors, The game box has an atomic space theme.

—user summary

Name: PANDO: Embarassment Pack
Description: 36 cards of potentially embarassing questions

Name: Behind Closed Doors: Res Life Training
Description:
Add a little fun to your training!
Behind Closed Doors is a card game designed to accompany the training of the commonly named Residence Life Resident Assistant student position. These cards reflect experiences from a multitude of schools and departments and is fun and interesting for new and veteran staff alike because it frames conversations and fosters the sharing of experiences for the supervisor to cover.

Staff draw cards and pick one scenario out of the hand to tackle, taking into account the difficulty of the situation which awards different point values. Staffs take turns attempting to resolve the situation to a supervisor or senior staff's satisfaction to earn points and avoid biting off more than they can choose and lose the points indicated. Rare game cards allow for lifelines, passing on difficult scenarios, and other helpful powers.

Behind Closed Doors is a training card game for employees of university residence life. Introduce your students to novel real-life situations, build team-work, and foster a supportive environment.

—description from the designer

Name: Chachapoya: Yayaucha Promo
Description:
The base Chachapoya game is expanded by a new obtainable but dangerous God of Sand cards. We should shuffle the YAYAUCHA promo cards into the treasure deck, after it prepare the other card as it's written in the game rules. 
In case of 2 players playing discard 20 randomly choosen cards. If 3 are playing discard 15 cards and if 4 players, discard 10 cards and put them back into the box without looking at them. 
These cards are not used in this game.
Follow the original game rules.
Enjoy playing the game and have fun with treasure hunting!

—description from the designer

Name: GYÜMI: Lemon Promo Card
Description:
Shuffle the lemon promo cards into the base Gyumi deck then prepare it as it’s written in the game rules. 
When a player draws a lemon card in its own round it’s obligatory to keep it! After placing the card the round is over. At the end of the game the obtained lemon cards should be scored as if they were normal fruits but with a minus sign!

—description from the designer

Name: PANDOS: The Family History Game Deluxe
Description:
This is a game about family history. Players attempt to answer questions about their family history. As each question is asked, the first to answer correctly scores a point. The first player to score five points wins.

The "Elders" (usually Mom and Dad, or Grandma and Grandpa) are those who will ask questions and who those questions will be about.

The "Progeny" is everyone else (typically family members).

Deluxe Edition limited to 200 copies available only through Kickstarter campaign.

Include First Edition of PANDO: The Family History Game and the Embarassment Pack expansion.

Set comes in a wooden box.

Name: Puzzell
Description:
The 9th core game for the ELL game system.

Make small fragments of the alphabet on one of 4 rows.

Each turn, draw a card, pick up a card from the end of a row, then place 2 cards. Placed cards and the card before them must form a 3-letter 'fragment' (3 consecutive letters, in order).

As each card can be used for 2 different letters, there is a skill in deciding what fragments to build.

At the end, you will have hopefully managed your cards so as to have some 'runs' of letters that you can place down to win the game!

—description from the publisher

Name: The City: Eco expansion
Description:
A 6-card Eco mini-expansion for the 2019 English edition of Tom Lehmann's "The City" published by Gryphon Games.  This mini-expansion features all new cards to build, including: Pedestrian Zone, Alternative Transportation, an Eco-Building, Green Energy Plant, and Ridesharing.

Unlike the iconic city replacement cards, these cards are simply added to the game. These cards include new icons and scoring possibilities to add more variance to the game.

This expansion came together with the 2019 Kickstarter edition of the game, but is not included in the standard retail edition.  It is expected to be available for separate purchase, e.g. as a separate promo pack through the BoardGameGeek store.

Name: Grasse: Mestres Perfumistas – Expansão 5º jogador
Description:
Component kit to add the 5th player to the Grasse game.

In this game, you assume the role of perfume producer in the town of Grasse, considered the world's fragrance capital since the nineteenth century. For this you must collect resources (bases and essences), conduct exchanges and purchases, producing classic or vanguard perfume and sell them. All your skills will be rewarded, Whether as a more versatile producer, producer specialized in a kind of perfumes, best sellers and best exhibitor.

The players will collect the resources moving their pawns in certain places on a track and should trigger special effects in buildings to produce perfumes.

The first fragrance from Grasse, the small village in southern France, was founded in 1849. Then come two other important fluff. Originally it was cultivated in the region of Grasse Murto, flower de orange, lavender and acacia. Later, the producers Began to import seedlings jasmine, rose and other varieties to grow in the region. It was at que time (early nineteenth century) that Grasse received the nickname of World Perfume Capital.

Demonstrate your skills to the best performer of the city of Grasse!

Name: Inspector McClue: Diamonds Aren't a Girl's Best Friend
Description:
Everyone's a suspect when murder is on the menu. And with a Classic Detective Murder Mystery you have everything you need to serve up the perfect murder dinner party. First the invites, you choose which of your friends play which devious suspect and invite them to come along as that character. Then the shopping list, menu suggestions and recipes. Plus of course...a really tasty murder to solve. It will be drop dead fun, and by the end of the evening, one (or more) of the suspects, your 'friends', will be caught out as the murderer!

It's 1919 and the world is still reeling from the shock of the Russian Revolution. For those inside the country, the political upheavals are matched by personal tragedies, and nowhere are this truer than within the Russian royal family. The Tsar, his wife and children have all been killed, and the surviving royals are anxious to escape the same fate. Which is why they are now sailing into exile on board the British warship the HMS Winston.

But even here, it seems, no one is safe. On the second night of their voyage a stowaway is discovered on board. He's found face-down in one of the lifeboats, and he has a jewel-encrusted dagger stuck in is back. Who is this mystery man? Who killed him? And what does any of this have to do with the assassination three years earlier of the mad mystic, Rasputin?

The suspects are:

     Dowager Empress Marie – The mother of the murdered Tsar and the great matriarch of European royalty, she is reluctant to leave Mother Russia for the first, and maybe the last, time.
     Prince Felix Youssoupov – The playboy prince whose behaviour scandalised St Petersburg and is most famous for being the man who killed Rasputin.
     Princess Ivana Legova – A niece of the Tsar, she is reputed to be the richest woman in Europe, particularly since the death of her financier husband.
     Grand Duke Boris Borisovich – One of the great landowners of Russia, though the source of his wealth is still something of a mystery.
     Captain Pretty – The naval officer in command of HMS Winston is very young for such a position, but he has a distinguished war record and is expected to rise high in the service.
     Martha Harry – An American journalist who has been covering the Revolution for the Washington Fox and now seems in something of a hurry to leave the country.
     Charles Bronstein – With mixed American and Russian parentage, he has been brought along to act as translator between the royals and the naval officers.
     Jane bond – An Englishwoman who was employed as a nanny for the Tsar’s daughters and is now accepted as almost part of the family.


—description from the back of the box

Name: BrainBox: Time Traveller
Description: This super BrainBox board game now takes every player to the past to experience the age of the dinosaurs or the defining moments of ancient Egyptian civilization. The social goal is for players to memorize as much information as possible within 10 seconds about the tales on the drawn card. After the time has elapsed, you must correctly answer the number rolled dice. The answers can be checked on the card.

Name: Múlt-Kor: A kocka el van vetve
Description: How many questions do you know the right answer to? The Past Age: Dice is a Discarded Board Game is a quiz game that you can play at family gatherings and parties, as can many! In the box, you will find 1500 questions and corresponding answers, players will advance on the board with puppets. Never worry if you are in the back of the queue, with a few good answers you can jump right into the first place right away, and at first glance, they can be army drives. The questions were selected in the fields of history, literature, and the arts. The Past Age: The cube is a discarded board game for those who can even laugh at themselves and who do not trust everything but use their knowledge.

Name: Power im Park
Description:
This game wants to put a focus on the rights children (should) have.
On a 7 by 7 grid square tiles similar to Labyrinth show paths and dead ends. On your turn, roll a colored die that allows you to flip, rotate or switch one or more tiles. (The color „red“ on the die allows  to go directly to an adjacent tile ignoring the path system.) Then move your pawn along the paths to reach a destination. Each player has one secret destination card and tries to accomplish it. After you reached your destination, try to accomplish the task or answer the question. The other players may help you. If you succeed, read the written text (articles of the convention of children’s rights) on the back of the tile aloud and keep the card. When all destinations are reached, the player with the most accomplished cards wins.

Developed by Matthias Gradinger
Produced by Ravensburger Freizeit- und Promotion-Service GmbH.

Name: Risk: The Battle for Medieval England
Description:
England has faced many battles in the past; The Battle of Hastings in 1066, prompting the Norman Conquest; The Second Barons’ War of the Roses in 1471, Securing the throne for Edward IV; Culminating in The Battle of Bosworth Field in 1485, where Richard III of the House of York was killed, heralding the end of the Plantagenet dynasty and the birth of the Tudor age.
In our new Risk game it’s your turn to engage in combat never before seen on such a scale, attempting to conquer England and take the crown!
Play as one of five different armies, as you try to capture England and take the throne. Only once all opposition has been wiped out can you lay your claim and become the true King or Queen of England.
As you fight for supremacy, the opposing armies will do their best to stop you. If your army is not victorious by the end of the Middle Ages, then the battle is over and all armies must retreat as the king’s men regain control of the land. With special Power cards to boost your forces or destroy your plans, and special missions to capture strategic strongholds, this game of Risk is an epic battle for control of England.. and the royal throne.

—description from the publisher

Name: Republia
Description:
To lie or not to lie...but the power must be yours!

Republia is a role playing game about politics, where you have to create your own discourse based on words highlighted in law cards and try to pass them to achieve your ideology's objective.

You'll play as a Libertarian, a Monarchist, as the Neo Liberal, Fascist, Communist, Totalitarian, Anarchist or Socialist. Organize Coups, Rallies and much more in this 3 to 8 player game.

To win, you must move the Population Token to your ideology's Point on the board, or gather Corruption points and Political Power to achieve its Objective.

—description from the designer

Name: Catacombs (Third Edition): Wand of Chaos Expansion
Description:
Originally available as part of the Dice Tower 2019 Kickstarter campaign.

A new promo pack that can work with both Catacombs (third edition) includes:

Hero: Varesh
Rules: Varesh
Ability: 2 Chaos Dice
Item: Wand of Chaos
Room: 8 new cards

Name: Bagan, the boardgame
Description:
Bagan is a mystic place, in the heart of Myanmar. It is a place filled with thousands of towers and temples, as far as the eye can reach. It is one of the most intriguing places on earth! But in this area you can expect some devastating earthquakes.

The aim of the game is to build temples in the city of Bagan in order to collect the most points. 
In the building school, you can train your builders to become a master or architect. This will make it easier for you to build the right building pieces, but you will not be able to use those builders to build on temple grounds.
A part of the game play is based on that other famous tower, the Hanoi tower. This means you can not build or move a large boulder on top of a smaller one.

A player's turn consists of:

     The (re)placing of the builder(s) on temple grounds and in the building school.
     Rolling the building dice or moving a building piece.
     If the player has builders on the beginner's places in the building school: draw action cards.


Play continues until all the action cards have been used or until the Central Temple has been completed. Then, points are counted.

The higher the temple, the more points you get. Empty or hardly built-up temple grounds with only one building piece give you penalty points. The player with the highest score wins.

The game is a mixture of strategy, luck and tactics. 
A lot of choices have to be made: Choose whether to train your workers, or let them build temples. Choose whether to build higher temples or more. Decide whether moving a boulder is a better choice than building one...

—description from the designer

Name: Cards Against Health IT
Description:
To start the game, each player draws five white cards.

The player who has most recently logged into an EHR goes first. The player flips over a green card and reads the question or phrase aloud.
